chapter.title: Declarative Exception Mapping
chapter.para: The JAX-RS specification comes with Exception Mapping Providers as a standard mechanism for treating Java exceptions. This approach works fine for complex cases, however, the exception handling logic is often trivial and not worth implementing Exception Mapper Providers for each exception type. In these situations, declarative approach is more appropriate. The Seam RESTEasy module allows exception types to be bound to HTTP responses declaratively.
For each exception type, it is possible to specify the status code and the error message of the HTTP response.

example.title: HTTP response
example.programlisting:
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found Content-Type: application/xml Content-Length: 123
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?> <error> <message>Requested resource does not exist.</message> </error>

chapter.para: Furthermore, EL expressions can be used in message templates to provide dynamic and more descriptive error messages.

example.title: Exception mapping configuration in seam-beans.xml
example.programlisting: <resteasy:ExceptionMapping exceptionType="javax.persistence.NoResultException" statusCode="404"> <resteasy:message>Requested resource with id #{pathParameters['id']} does not exist.</resteasy:message> </resteasy:ExceptionMapping>

chapter.para: The error message is marshalled within a JAXB object. As a result, the error message is available in multiple media formats. The most commonly used formats are XML and JSON. RESTEasy provides media providers for both of these formats. In addition, the error message is also available in plain text.
